channel.title: Metis
channel.description:
[b]Background:[/b] I haven't done a full-fledged server in a while so I figured I'd need to get back into the RSPS scene. This server is being developed off of Devolution 7.0 and has been for roughly a week now. What I am doing with Devolution 7.0 is stripping it of its current excess junk and rewriting what needs to be rewritten (e.g combat, skills, maybe even some of the server's core). My goal is to make this server's design more object-oriented than it is now, using more classes instead of just a few that were provided.
[b]What I Plan To Do:[/b] With Metis, I plan to move people away from DeltaScape and move to a friendly base that will be used with ease; I am also hoping for Metis to be a good learning experience for people that come to it.
[b]Classes I've Added So Far:[/b]
[ul][li]ActionButton[/li] [li]ItemOnItem[/li] [li]NPCClick[/li] [li]Commands[/li] [li]Fishing[/li] [li]Saving[/li] [li]Herblore[/li] [li]Crafting[/li][/ul]
[b]Classes Removed So Far:[/b]
[ul][li]BanHammer[/li] [li]MD5[/li] [li]PkMatch[/li][/ul]
There are several others that will be removed in due time as well.
With the process of optimization and removing junk, I have gotten the Client class down to [b]352kb[/b].
By the time the first revision (hopefully relatively soon) is released, I plan to have a decent server base that will be used by some prospering developers.

item.title: Metis
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“glestrts, post:4, topic:336275”]goodluck with this, i recently cleaned devo v7 to rip some frames for my source, and i was absolutely astonished at the amount of junk that wasn’t even used, but still in the source.

Im hoping you can keep with this for awhile, because it sounds like it will be epic.

Edit::: btw what is metis, i would swear ive heard this name before.
Edit::: Edit::: http://www.cs.umbc.edu/~turner/metis.html thats what i was thinking of.[/quote]

It was named after the Greek Goddess, but I find it funny how worked out that way.

Read full topic
